requirements.summary: Create calculator interface with number buttons, decimal point, and clear button
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows number pad with digits 0-9
Decimal point button is present and functional
Clear button resets the calculator display to 0

file_operations.description: Create Calculator component with number buttons (0-9), decimal point button, and clear button. Use shadcn/ui Button components for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create reusable CalculatorButton component that wraps shadcn/ui Button with calculator-specific styling and behavior. Support different button types (number, operation, function). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement arithmetic operation buttons for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
acceptanceCriteria: Addition (+) button performs correct calculations
Subtraction (-) button performs correct calculations
Multiplication (×) button performs correct calculations
Division (÷) button performs correct calculations
Equals (=) button displays the result of the operation

file_operations.description: Add operation buttons (+, -, ×, ÷) and equals button to the Calculator component. Wire operation buttons to trigger calculation logic. Ensure buttons use CalculatorButton component for consistency.

Create custom hook to manage calculator state and arithmetic operations. Implement functions for handleNumberInput, handleOperation, handleEquals, and handleClear. Return state and handler functions for component usage.

requirements.summary: Add display screen showing current input and calculation results
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows numbers as they are entered
Display updates to show calculation results when equals is pressed
Display handles multi-digit numbers correctly
Display shows appropriate feedback for invalid operations (e.g., division by zero)

file_operations.description: Create CalculatorDisplay component to show current number input and results. Handle multi-digit numbers, decimal points, and error messages. Style with earth tone theme for readability.
Integrate CalculatorDisplay component at the top of the calculator interface. Pass display value and error state from useCalculator hook to the display component.
Add error handling for invalid operations like division by zero. Return error state and display value for the CalculatorDisplay component to consume.

requirements.summary: Implement calculator logic for sequential operations and state management
acceptanceCriteria: Calculator correctly chains multiple operations (e.g., 5 + 3 - 2 = 6)
Pressing an operation button after equals uses the previous result
Calculator handles decimal number calculations accurately
Invalid operations display appropriate error messages

file_operations.description: Enhance calculation logic to support operation chaining. Track previous result, current operation, and input state. Handle decimal calculations with precision. Implement logic for using previous result when starting a new operation after equals.

Create utility functions for arithmetic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide). Include validation and error handling for edge cases like division by zero. Handle decimal precision appropriately.

requirements.summary: Design cohesive visual theme with warm earth tones and clear typography
acceptanceCriteria: Color scheme consistently uses warm earth tone palette
Typography is clear and legible for numbers and operations
Button layout follows standard calculator conventions
Visual hierarchy clearly distinguishes number buttons from operation buttons

file_operations.description: Extend Tailwind theme with warm earth tone color palette (terracotta, sand, olive). Define custom colors for calculator buttons, display, and background. Configure typography settings for clear number display.

Add global CSS variables and styles for calculator theme. Define consistent spacing, border radius, and shadow styles using earth tone palette. Ensure typography is legible for calculator numbers and operations.

Apply earth tone theme to Calculator component layout. Use CSS Grid for standard calculator button arrangement (4×5 grid typical). Differentiate operation buttons from number buttons with distinct colors and visual weight.
Apply theme styling to button variants (number, operation, function). Use earth tones with appropriate contrast for accessibility. Implement hover and active states consistent with the theme.
Style display with earth tone background and high-contrast text. Use clear, large typography for numbers. Apply consistent padding and visual hierarchy within the calculator interface.

Wire Calculator component into the main App component. Center the calculator on the page with appropriate background using earth tone palette. Remove or replace any placeholder content with the calculator interface.
